quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: School and Students
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, schools, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: About 85% of this schools students study abroad. It also has the largest percentage of students who serve in the Peace Corps.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kalamazoo  College

questions.question: Which college has the largest endowment?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard

questions.question: What company had the first service uniform registered with the United States Patent  Trademark Office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Playboy Enterprises

questions.question: Dixie State College is located in this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Utah

questions.question: In terms of yearly undrgraduate  tuition the most expensive college in the USA is in this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Georgia

questions.question: Although never on display, the Smithsonian has among all its dusty artifacts John Dillingers penis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Aaay! Happy Days are here again. When the Smithsonian added this characters leather jacket to their collection, the Smithsonian became the epitome of  Cool.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fonzie

questions.question: All of the 80 or so  students at this college spend half their sophmore  years in Rome,Italy. Which school is this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas More College

questions.question: This is a small engineering school that gives full scholarships to all of its students. Exams at this school  are taken outside of class and students are allowed to use any source (other than other people) to answer test questions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Olin College

questions.question: This college is unique in that it usually admits students before they graduate high school.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simons Rock College of Bard

questions.question: This is a two year school that has a student  body numbering under 30. It is over 40 miles from the nearest town. The school generates its own electricity from solar panels. Which college is this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deep Springs College, California

questions.question: Dawn Moore donated, at her Fathers request, an item worn by her fathers most famous character, John Reid. John Reid would be a combination of Zorro, Robin Hood and the Texas Rangers. By what name is John Reid better known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lone Ranger

questions.question: In this school, undergraduates are allowed to design and teach their own courses. It was the first college to regularly admit women and to regularly admit African-American students.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oberlin College

questions.question: Samhain is generally regarded as The Celtic New Year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: At this school, each student gets a full scholarship in return for  doing about 15 hours of  work each week on campus .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Berea College

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Samhain and New Orleans
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, bonfire, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In parts of Western Brittany, in France, cakes called kornigou are baked at Samhain.  What natural shape are the cakes baked in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antlers

questions.question: A European country and an African one have one and the same motto - Virtus Unita Fortior. Name the countries.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andorra and Angola

questions.question: Samhain was a time of bonfire rituals, what was the traditional number of bonfires built for a Samhain ceremony?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: The Irish word Samhain is derived from which Old Irish word?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In New Orleans one of the biggest festivals of the year is the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival. To locals it is known as Jazz Fest which celebrates the rich musical history of the city. In what year was Jazz Fest founded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1970

questions.question: Samhain is one of the eight annual Sabbats (holidays) of  Wiccans and is a celebration of darkness and death.  Wiccans have a festival at the beginning of the Summer season to celebrate life and fertility, what is its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beltaine

questions.question: In Ireland and Scotland the Féile na Marbh traditionally took place at Samhain.  What does Féile na Marbh mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Festival of the dead

questions.question: New Orleans musical history is rich, and many argue that the city is the birth place of Jazz. Many famous musicians of all genres including, jazz, blues, and rocknroll are proud to call New Orleans home. Which of the following musicians is not from New Orleans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miles Davis

questions.question: Which of the following countries mottoes is in Latin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sub umbra floreo

questions.question: The official motto of this country is the French phrase Liberté, égalité, fraternité.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: Samhain was a time when the future was divined for the forthcoming year.  Which of the following was not commonly used to divine the future at these times?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ouija board

questions.question: Identify the language behind each of the given country mottoes: 1) Un isla feliz, 2) Odlar Yurdu, 3) Brunei darussalam.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1) Papiamento, 2) Azeri, 3) Malay

questions.question: Sam Hain was the name of a character in the cartoon The Real Ghostbusters
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In modern Ireland and Scotland some areas still have the tradition of setting a place for the dead at Samhain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The word bonfire comes from the tradition of cooking meat on open fires during the Samhain ceremony.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Motto and New Orleans
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, figures, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 1875, Mardi Gras was declared an official holiday in Louisiana.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1988, what Mardi Gras Krewe was banned from throwing its prized golden coconuts from the floats?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zulu

questions.question: A king cake is a type of cake associated with the Carnival Season, traditionally holding a trinket inside.  Which of the following is not a traditional trinket, found inside a king cake?

options.text: a plastic king wearing a crown

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a doubloon

questions.question: Which of the following is Kenyas motto, that means Lets work together in Swahili?

options.text: Te mauri, te raoi ao te tabomoa

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harambee

questions.question: Name the Asian country whose official motto is the Islamic creed: There is no god but Allah and Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saudi Arabia

questions.question: The Mardi Gras season, known as the Carnival, begins on what day according to popular traditions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The twelfth day of Christmas

questions.question: This parade, which takes place on Mardi Gras Day is held by an organization called The School of Design and its official tune is If Ever I Cease to Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rex Parade

questions.question: Which French explorers are credited with bringing the Mardi Gras festivities to America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iberville and Bienville LeMoyne

questions.question: Which phrase meaning God and my right is the official Royal motto of the UK?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dieu et mon droit

questions.question: Which of the following phrases is the state motto of Switzerland as well as the motto of a famous book by Alexandre Dumas?

options.text: Unus pro omnibus, omnes pro uno

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unus pro omnibus, omnes pro uno

questions.question: Mardi Gras in New Orleans was cancelled during World War II.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Latin phrase Plus Ultra, often used by the Holy Roman Emperor Charles V as a personal motto, is nowadays the official motto of which European state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spain

questions.question: These burning kerosene torches, carried by twirling and dancing white-robed figures, traditionally light the night parades in New Orleans
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: flambeaux

questions.question: In New Orleans, the Carnival Season is culminated with the Meeting of Courts, which is a meeting of the royal courts of which two Krewes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rex and Comus

questions.question: Three of the following states dont have an official state motto. Guess the odd one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: West Virginia and Philippines
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, peak. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the first Filipino priest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Lakandula

questions.question: The first railroad built in the Philippines connects Manila to Dagupan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Why did West Virginia secede from Virginia and became a separate state?

options.text: Because of Virginias decision to secede from the Union.
Because there were a lot of Native American people in western Virginia and Virginia didnt want them.
Because the people of western Virginia felt like they werent getting enough attention from the government of Virginia.
Because western Virginia didnt believe in slave ownership.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of Virginias decision to secede from the Union.

questions.question: John Brown was a radical abolitionist who attempted to start a slave uprising by raiding an Armory in Harpers Ferry, West Virginia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who is considered the first Filipino citizen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luis Rodriguez Varela

questions.question: What is first TV station in the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ABS

questions.question: The New River is famous for what sport?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White-water rafting

questions.question: Where did the first mass in the Philippines take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Limasawa, Leyte

questions.question: The official Mardi Gras colors - purple, gold and green, were chosen in 1872.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What were Gods gifts to the Israelites?

options.text: grapes, figs, pomegranates, dates, wheat, barley

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: grapes, figs, pomegranates, dates, wheat, barley

questions.question: What mountain range is West Virginia located in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Appalachian

questions.question: Who was the first Portuguese explorer to reach Philippine soil on March 16,1521?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferdinand Magellan

questions.question: What is the highest peak in West Virginia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spruce Knob

questions.question: In what year was West Virginia admitted to the Union?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1863

questions.question: How many months were in the regular Israeli lunar calendar year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Novel and Jerusalem
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, tel, ship. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many tribes of Israel were there?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: The name of this American president is also the name of a fictional frigate from a novel by Jules Verne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: Name the black scary ship featured in the first movie of Pirates of the Caribbean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Black Pearl

questions.question: When was Jerusalem declared the eternal and indivisible capital of Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: Which of these ships was depicted in Joseph Conrads famous novella Heart of Darkness, published in 1902.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nellie

questions.question: The origin and meaning of the name of Jerusalem is debatable. Which of these is not a possible translation of Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: City of Great Valleys

questions.question: What is the name of the mythical ship on which Jason and the Argonauts sailed in quest for the Golden Fleece?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Argo

questions.question: What is the name of the fishing boat of the local shark hunter Quint in the legendary movie Jaws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Orca

questions.question: This is the ocean yacht of the Glenervans from Jules Vernes novel The Children of Captain Grant, on which the characters sailed in search of the castaways.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duncan

questions.question: Most countries have situated their Israeli embassies in Tel Aviv. The embassies of which four countries are located in Jerusalem?

options.text: The USA, the Netherlands, Canada, and Paraguay
The USA, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Costa Rica
Ireland, Sweden, El Salvador, and Costa Rica
Costa Rica, El Salvador, Bolivia, and Paraguay

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Costa Rica, El Salvador, Bolivia, and Paraguay

questions.question: Who was Abrahams nephew according to the Bible?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lot

questions.question: What is the name of Captain Larsons seal-hunting schooner from the novel The Sea Wolf by Jack London?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ghost

questions.question: What is the name of Captain Disko Troops ship from Rudyard Kiplings novel Captains Courageous.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Were Here

questions.question: What is the name of the mystic haunted ship in the 2002 horror movie Ghost Ship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antonia Graza

questions.question: Which ship was described by Scottish author Robert Louis Stevenson in the novel The Treasure Island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hispaniola

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Jerusalem and Letter
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, field, battery. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is not the name of a main street in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dizengoff Street

questions.question: What major body of water provided the citizens of Jerusalem with fresh water in later Biblical times?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pool of Siloam

questions.question: What code word is assigned to the letter W in the Military Alphabet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whiskey

questions.question: The topographic profile of Jerusalem is characterized by a number of valleys, surrounding all sides of the city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: If you met a girl nicknamed Charlie, you might pick up a bottle of W and head to the 8th letter of the phonetic alphabet. What word is assigned to this letter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hotel

questions.question: What does Lima Zulu stand for?

options.text: Lemonade stand run by Zulu warriors

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Landing Zone

questions.question: What is the Arabic name of Jerusalem, used by many Islam-influenced cultures?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al-Quds

questions.question: The names of these two lovers are used in the Military Alphabet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romeo and Juliet

questions.question: This boulevard is West Jerusalems inner city expressway, which goes North to South from Atarot to Malcha.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Begin Boulevard

questions.question: Who was the first ancient ruler, who officially declared Jerusalem capital of the Kingdom of Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King David

questions.question: Which of these animals is the ancient symbol of Jerusalem and the Jewish People?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The lion

questions.question: What code word is assigned to the letter R in the Military Alphabet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romeo

questions.question: What code word is assigned to the letter N in the Military Alphabet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: November

questions.question: If you are a member of Delta Battery, your battalion most likely consists of how many batteries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Most of Jerusalems workforce is employed in what field?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Services
